intro: Faroa paradoxa, commonly known as the Madagascar star tree, is a unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to produce a milky latex when damaged, which contains compounds of potential medicinal interest. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, Faroa paradoxa is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native range.
